formatting.description: These attributes are used to format the filename when no information is available, and can generally be set to whatever you'd like.

dry.description: When True, the program will perform a dry run and not make any changes to the system or file structure. Defaults to False.

options.True: Perform a dry run and display hypothetical changes.
options.False: Perform the operation and save changes to the system or file structure.

error_msg.description: error message that will be displayed during Exceptions. Multiple options can be used. Add them to the error_msg list or add with the set command

options.warning: Non-critical issue that may affect program functionality.
options.custom: Custom error message defined by the user, add color with [<color>], for more info check out the 'rich' project docs.

database.description: This is the default path for the libraries database.

extractor.description: This is the extractor used to extract the filename data as a dict. There are two options: 'standard' and 'youtube'.

options.standard: This extractor will extract the filename using artist, title, features and misc as data settings.
options.youtube: This extractor will extract the filename using artist, title, features, misc and youtube_id as data settings.

constructor.description: Construct a formatted file name using a dict of values pulled from extractor, stylized by the constructor.

directory.description: This is the default directory where files will be saved, searched for, etc.

exts.description: This is a list of valid file extensions that the program will accept.
exts.options: A comma-separated list of file extensions.
